description: Use this boolean to validate the request without processing it.

External_Integration_ID_Reference_Data.description: Display name inside the Workday system.

ID.description: Integration system identifier, part of a two part key (including the text value of the ID element) that uniquely identify integratable object.

validation.validation: Integration System ID does not exist.
validation.description: A valid instance of Integration ID must exist for the given System ID.

External_Integration_ID_Reference_Data.description: External ID that uniquely identifies the integratable object within the context of the integration system identified by the System ID attribute.

Organization_Reference.description: Integration ID reference is used as a unique identifier for integratable objects in the Workday system.

description: Reference element representing a unique instance of Organization.

validation.validation: Organization Reference Integration ID does not exist!
validation.description: A valid instance of Organization must exist for the given Integration ID Reference.

validation.validation: Organization Reference references an Inactive Organization.
validation.description: A valid instance of Organization also infers that the Organization is in an Active status.

Organization_Inactivate_Data.description: The effective date of the organization inactivation.

description: This element contains the effective date that the organization is inactivated.
Use this boolean to keep the organization in hierarchy.

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Use this element to specify the new superior organization for current subordinates. When blank, default behavior is that active organizations are moved to superior.

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Use this element to specify the new superior organization for current included organizations. When blank, default behavior is that active organizations are moved to superior.

Use this boolean to remove all direct role assignments as of the inactivation effective date and later. If empty or FALSE, direct role assignments will remain as is. Inherited role assignments will remain as is if you choose to keep the organization in the hierarchy.
